alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 23 at 12:16AM MST until November 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches at lower elevations with 6 to 8 inches in the north Laramie Range. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Converse County Lower Elevations, Niobrara County, North Laramie Range and North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills
